text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am Noti a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Cape Town
today I'm going to show you how to
resolve the connection timeout on
endpoint URL error that you might
encounter when trying to connect to an 8
hour service from your Amazon sagemaker
notebook let's get started
this error occurs when the notebook
instances subnet does not have an Amazon
virtual private cloud or Amazon VPC
endpoint for the servers you are trying
to connect to or when the subnet can't
access the internet there are two
options to resolve
this option one if the aw service that
you want to connect to offers end points
then you can add a VPC service endpoint
to The Notebook instances subnet many a
Services offers either an interface
endpoint or a Gateway endpoint to add a
VPC service endpoint to the instance
subnet open the Amazon VPC
console in the navigation pan choose end
points then choose create
endpoint select the service that you
want to connect
to select the VPC and subnet
and then configure any additional
settings review your configuration and
then create the
endpoint option two the other option is
to create a new notebook instance with
direct internet access or add a net
Gateway
for direct internet access create a new
notebook instance on the SE maker
console click on
notebooks click on create notebook
instance fill in all the necessary
details expand network
settings leave their VPC unselected Sage
maker will provide the internet access
click on create notebook
instance if you don't want to activate
direct internet access then you can add
a net gateway to your private notebook
instance subnet to allow internet
connectivity make sure that your subnet
is private to add a net gateway to your
private subnet open the VPC
console navigate to net
gateways and then choose create net
Gateway select the subnet to add the net
gateway to for connectivity type choose
public and then configure any other
settings finally create the net
Gateway after you create the net Gateway
add it to your notebook instances Subnet
in the navigation pan choose route
tables select the route table that's
associated with your notebook instances
subnet choose the route table Tab and
then choose edit route choose your
destination internet IP address and then
select your net Gateway as Target click
on Save
changes after you add the VPC endpoint
or activate internet access you can now
connect to the AWS servers from your
sagemaker notebook without timeout
errors so now you know how to resolve
the connection timeout on endpoint URL
error when connecting to AWS services
from an Amazon s maker
notebook thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
